title: Question 11
prompt:
As layers of rock are formed in the earth, the remains of plants and animals from the time the rock was formed become fossils in the rock. Generally, the layers of rock furthest below the surface of the earth were formed longest ago.

This diagram represents the layers of rock uncovered in a specific region. Based on in this diagram, what would this region have looked like back when it was newly formed?
feedback: The text states that the layers of rock furthest below the surface of the earth were formed longest ago. In other words, the deepest rocks are the oldest. The fossils found in the oldest rock, freshwater fish and algae, indicate that the land was a freshwater lake longest ago.
